required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Preeclampsia and Positive for Obstructive Sleep Apnea Screening Test: STOPBANG Questionnaire

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find the correlation between high risk OSA (obstructive sleep apnea) patient, based on Stop-bang screening tool and preeclampsia

detailed_description.textblock:
Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) has been associated with preeclampsia and intrauterine growth retardation (IUGR).
Since the gold standard diagnosis of OSA is polysomnogram which is limited by cost and availability. Therefore, various screening tools were proposed in order to identify high risk OSA patient such as Stop-bang questionnaire.
From the previous study, Stop-bang showed a high predictive performance and the score equal or higher than 3 determines high risk for OSA.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pre-eclampsia between high and low risk of OSA patient based on Stop-bang screening test

secondary_outcome.measure: prevalence of pre-eclampsia between high and low risk of OSA patient, based on Epworth sleepiness scale
prevalence of pre-eclampsia between high and low risk of OSA patient, based on Berlin questionnaire
prevalence of pre-eclampsia between high and low risk of OSA patient, based on American society check list
The prevalence of maternal adverse event between high risk and low risk of OSA patient
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal adverse events include hypoxemia, arrythmia, perioperative myocardial infarction, heart failure

secondary_outcome.measure: The prevalence of neonatal adverse event between high risk and low risk of OSA patient
secondary_outcome.description: Neonatal adverse events include IUGR, neonatal intensive care unit admission, low apgar score

arm_group.description: High risk OSA defines as Stop-bang score â‰¥ 3
Low risk OSA defines as Stop-bang score < 3

study_pop.textblock: Thai pregnant women who were scheduled for cesarean delivery or vaginal delivery at Ramathibodi hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women who were scheduled for cesarean delivery or admitted to the antepartum unit at Ramathibodi hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 year old
- Previous diagnose OSA
- Patients who have used continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) or bi-level positive airway pressure (Bi-PAP) fro OSA treatment

reference.citation: Chung F, Yegneswaran B, Liao P, Chung SA, Vairavanathan S, Islam S, Khajehdehi A, Shapiro CM. STOP questionnaire: a tool to screen patients for obstructive sleep apnea. Anesthesiology. 2008 May;108(5):812-21. doi: 10.1097/ALN.0b013e31816d83e4.

Pengo MF, Rossi GP, Steier J. Obstructive sleep apnea, gestational hypertension and preeclampsia: a review of the literature. Curr Opin Pulm Med. 2014 Nov;20(6):588-94. doi: 10.1097/MCP.0000000000000097. Review.

Antony KM, Agrawal A, Arndt ME, Murphy AM, Alapat PM, Guntupalli KK, Aagaard KM. Association of adverse perinatal outcomes with screening measures of obstructive sleep apnea. J Perinatol. 2014 Jun;34(6):441-8. doi: 10.1038/jp.2014.25. Epub 2014 Mar 6.
